Sequence Information.Peptide Name: BP125 (BP76 analog, synthetic AMPs, Leu-rich; Lys-rich; XXA, UCLL1c; alternatively modified: BP126)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is most similar (81.82%) toBP76K: 55%; L: 27%.Chemical modification:  tosylated form.Activity: active against plant pathogenic bacterial strains P. syringae pv. syringae (MIC 2.5-5.0 uM), X. axonopodis pv. vesicatoria (MIC 2.5-5.0 uM), and E-amylovora (MIC >7.5 uM).Toxicity: human RBC: HC50 >150 uM, not hemo.lytic.SAR: the peptide became slightly more active against Ea when benzylation (BP126), rather than tosylation, was made.Plant protection:apple: Plant protection:pear: flowers pretreated at 100 and 200 uM of BP125 or BP126 reduced the infection of plant pathogen E. amylovora.
Literature Information.Author: Badosa E, Ferre R, Planas M, Feliu L, Besalú E, Cabrefiga J, Bardají E, Montesinos E.2007
Literature Information.Title: A library of linear undecapeptides with bactericidal activity against phytopathogenic bacteria.
